fields.title: Length Matters
fields.content: Make your password at least 12-16 characters long Longer passwords generally offer better security

fields.title: Variety
fields.content: Use a combination of upper and lower case letters, numbers, and special characters

fields.title: Avoid Personal Information
fields.content: Do not use easily available information like your name, birthdate, or username

fields.title: Password Managers
fields.content: Consider using a password manager to keep track of your passwords securely

fields.title: Regularly Update
fields.content: Change your passwords regularly, at least every 3-6 months

fields.title: Unique for Every Account
fields.content: Don't reuse passwords Each account should have its own unique password

fields.title: Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)
fields.content: Whenever available, enable 2FA for an added layer of security

fields.title: Avoid Common Words
fields.content: Stay away from dictionary words, phrases, or sequential numbers

fields.title: Check Breaches
fields.content: Use platforms like "Have I Been Pwned?" to check if your password has been compromised in a data breach

fields.title: Secure Recovery
fields.content: Ensure that your password recovery options (like security questions) are not easily guessable
